reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have stayed here a number of times and it just gets better! The staff are wonderful, they are so welcoming and nothing is too much trouble.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, second to none.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed in a number of 5* hotels this one really lives up to its rating. The moment you arrive you know that you are in for a treat. At check in we were upgraded to a side sea view room. given a nice cold welcome drink and introduced to the Head Porter who promptly took us to our room. The meals in the hotel (buffet) are extremely well presented with staff who are very friendly and nothing is too much trouble.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is about a 20 minute pleasant stroll from the harbour and the buses are within easy reach. Don't miss a trip to the Tomb of the KIngs a lovely 10 minute walk away from the hotel.
reviews.title: `How could we ask for more?

reviews.text: Overall you get what you pay for at this hotel. A team of people who know how to treat guests. A super hotel, well done!!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel with amazing staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a weekend at Elysium hotel, we have been there for a seminar bur also my family was there for leisure. The hotel is absolutely amazing! Huge with extraordinary decoration, with absolutely everything anyone would like. The staff is more than friendly, all with smiling faces ready to help anyway.
reviews.title: 7 Day Spring Break at the Elysium Hotel

reviews.text: We loved this hotel and agree with all other positives stated here and importantly we would book again. Lucky to be given rooms with a great sea view ( 3230 and 3234 ). Stayed from 15th April with two children 12 and 15, for a week on half board: breakfast/ buffet dinner ( both excellent ). Dinner can be traded in at lunchtime as long as you keep within 15 Euros per adult and half of that per child which is good if you decided to venture to local surrounds and try a meal out which we did twice. We did some homework before we left home and chatted to new friends made on holiday to avoid bad restaurants. Old Paphos had a couple of good ones ( La Sardegna da Gino - great on food portions, atmosphere price and quality ) and we thought the food at Sienna was very good although it lacked local Cypriot customers and was a quiet place.
reviews.title: Luxurious hotel in terms of service, cleanliness, food, staff and the pools and sunbed areas are beautiful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's true that the beach is not very glamorous as the sand is dark but it is private and kept clean and when the green flag is flying a swim in the bay is pure bliss. We had very mixed weather but we told after May it is sunny every day.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is great if you want a short transfer from Paphos airport, which is summer heat with children could well be an advantage, so I would not be put off by that.
reviews.title: Elysium = paradise!
A Very nice hotel
reviews.text: The area is a bit grotty especially just on the strip outside the hotel but it really did not bother us as we were mostly relaxing in the hotel. We did want to explore further and hired a car ( through Olympic and you have to take for a minimum of three days ). Everything was fine and car delivered and picked up from hotel. Worth noting that you have to pay a standard 70 Euros for one full tank of petrol even if you do not use it. Poli and Latchi were our favorites. A trip up to the Troodos mountains worth the trip.

reviews.text: Evening meal great as part of a half board deal but might be a bit expensive if bought separately at 39 euros per head excluding drinks.
reviews.title: Excellent, but not 5 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed in many top class hotels around Europe and USA over many years of business and leisure travel and the Elysium rates amoung the very best for many reasons - the location is fabulous with its own beach, pier and fantastic gardens - the pool areas are top quality the excellant Pool Bar service at good prices bearing in mind its a 5 start hotel - the themed Dinner Buffets vary every night and are of very good quality - the breakfast scores 10/10 for quality and variety - the bedroom was also very good with one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in - British TV reception BBC1, BBC2 & ITV are also availbale at no extra cost - the attention to detail was outstanding and the kindness of staff remarkable (friendly but not pushy) - the only negative comment I have was that the WiFi was expensive when most cheaper hotels and bars now offer free WiFi I am not sure why considering the price it was not free here also (I used a t-mobile broadband dongle instead with very fast connection speed) - cannot wait to stay at the Elysium
reviews.title: Fabulous Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were given upgrade from an inland view to a car park view, which hotel called a side sea view. All we could see, unless stand in the corner of the balcony and look right, car park view! This is the worst view we ever had, but we must have been also unlucky as it seems that other people enjoyed their rooms. To us the room was nothing special, we must have had our expectaions too high.
reviews.title: Dated design, not for young couples, no atmosphere, nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked Half Board and were promised that we can eat in all restaurants, which turned out to be not true. Most of the time only 2 restaurants were open.On most nights we were having dinner (Half Board) in Banquet Hall that looks like a dungeon. We jus could wait to eat and get out of their. If we would chose to go to eat to other restaurant, we be given only discount of 15 eur per person. Dinner would cost over 100 eur for a couple. Noone have told us that prior the booking, although i did call hotel to ask this specific question. They chose to tell half of the information.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels we've ever stayed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived just before 22.00, when we went to our room there was no cold plates in the rooms. Now this hotel says they are 5* and it was not 5* service level, in all other hotels we always had food in the room if we arrived too late. When we asked to transfer the missed dinner for last night, reception was very reluctant to do so and only after we insisted that they speak to a manager, we got a voucher that we could use in the restaurant. We were very pleased for that as otherwise we would have to pay 39 eur per person for food plus drinks.
reviews.title: Loved the Elysium - highly recommend it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel looks very grand on pictures, but it is not for young couples, design is old fashioned, there was no atmosphere and absolutely nothing to do. We would recomend this hotel to old people, not for young or middle age. We didnt feel that it was a special hotel for a holiday, if we havent had a car, i just dont know what you could do their all day.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel, lovely setting & wonderful staff & amenities
